reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Yamakyu so that we could get to shirakawago easily the next day. It is not too far from the station, quite easy to locate as roads in Takayama runs in a grid.
reviews.title: Fantastic Food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The dinner certainly left a deep impression... Authentic,delicious Japanese food served in a multi-course meal... If you stay here, be sure to try the dinner!
reviews.title: Fantastic Ryokan!

likes.liked: — Food and service were both amazing.
likes.disliked: — Sleeping on the floor is rough, but very Japanese!

reviews.text: Yamakyu has its own onsen with indoor+outdoor tub too!
reviews.title: Takayama and Yamakyu Experience Extraordenaire

likes.disliked: — the futon mattresses were rather thin but you can ask for another to double up on

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You could walk to Yamakyu from Takayama Station which would probably take 15-20 mins however if (like us) you had plenty of luggage a taxi from the station cost about 800 yen for an 8min trip. Having arrived prior to the check in time the proprietor was more than happy to provide maps and suggestions and even allowed us to use two of their bicycles to explore Takayama free of charge which is highly recommended. Upon our return our bags were stored in our small room which did however contain it's own sink and toilet. The kaiseki dinner was good and enjoyed with the other guests in a dining hall, as to was the breakfast. There is also a small public bath downstairs which was great after a day bike riding! The only criticism is the smoke. Smoking is allowed through the ryokan and even though we were in a non-smoking room, by the morning our room reeked from all the smoke rising into our room on the first floor. Great service however and the owner even dropped us off a the station the next morning.
reviews.title: A good mid-price Ryokan experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights at Yamakyu and we had a great time in there. Its position is perfect, not in the centre of the town but close a beautiful walk through magnificent temples.Our room was small but clean and warm. The entire ryokan is well furbished and the bathrooms are new and so relaxing.
reviews.title: the perfect choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: People are kind and gentle. A perfect place to have relax and peace of mind.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised and very happy with the choice.

reviews.text: I kindly suggest this place in takayama to everone!
reviews.title: Excellent choice for authentic traditional Japanese stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having travelled to Takayama from Hakone (about 5 hours by train) we arrived to the middle of nowhere, in the dark, with no email confirmation that we would be collected as arranged by the Yamakyu staff. I'm not going to lie, I was slightly apprehensive..
reviews.title: Delightful Ryokan experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for two nights recently and thought it was just perfect. Takayama is a beautiful town - and this inn was just the type of place we wanted to stay. It's traditional - so you sleep on tatami mats and although we had a sink and toilet, did not have our own shower/bath (so we used the baths). As an American who is used to some privacy while bathing, I was not sure how I would handle this - but it was completely fine and I never saw another person, anyway (by the way - these are single sex baths). The baths feel great, too - was such a treat at the end (and start) of the day! The inn is very sweet and quirky, as far as decoration (there is also a lovely garden within the hotel - our room looked out onto it), and the food is fantastic - amazing kaiseki meals that just went on and on and on (we ate both dinner and breakfast there)! They also offered free internet access (in the sitting area), which was nice. The location was great, too - right near a shrine and about five minutes walk from the center of town. All in all, it was a wonderful experience.
reviews.title: Wonderful traditional inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After staying in Tokyo/ Nagoya it was so refreshing to come to Takayama - it's a lovely town near the mountains.
reviews.title: Great experience - highlight of our trip

reviews.text: And staying at this Minshuku was a great - it let us experience Japanese style accomodation, onsen and hospitality. My wife was almost in shock initially at the basic room, and need to use the onsen for a shower, but quickly came to love it.
reviews.title: One of the highlights of our accommodation options whilst in Japan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are very friendly and helpful, and the food is - well almost ridiculous. I think we had 12 dishes one night - its overkill. But the fussiest eater should find something they like amongst them; we tried most. I would recommend only having the food package for a day or two or it will be disastrous for your waistline.
reviews.title: A good, affordable ryokan experience with excellent food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I must admit after 3 days we were glad to move to a 'western style' hotel with a more comfortable bed, but would thoroughly recommend a stay in this town and this minshuku in particular if you want a real 'japanese' experience.
reviews.title: You get a lot for your money !
